Description: Egyptian terracotta figure of a woman. She is walking to the right, possibly followed by someone to the right. Mould-made from a two-piece mould and hollow. Traces of a white coating. Red-brown Nile silt fabric, with abundant mica and sand inclusions. Head, base and back are missing.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.410) (Phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4561 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
